text.div:
Id: DT.IMMZ.D2.DT.Measles.Supplementarydose
Url: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Version: 0.2.0
Title: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Status: draft
Date: 2025-07-17 20:56:23+0000
Publisher: WHO
Description:

Determine required vaccinations
Knowledge Capability: computable
Related Artifacts:

References

  • WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1)
Libraries:
DTs.Measles
Actions:
Client is not due for measles supplementary dose: Client is not due for measles supplementary dose "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" An additional dose of MCV should be administered to children infected with HIV receiving highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) following immune reconstitution. If CD4+ T lymphocyte counts are monitored, an additional dose of MCV should be administered when immune reconstitution has been achieved (e.g. when the CD4+ T lymphocyte count reaches 20–25%). Where CD4+ T lymphocyte monitoring is not available, children should receive an additional dose of MCV 6–12 months after initiation of HAART. As a general rule, live vaccines should be given either simultaneously or at intervals of 4 weeks. An exception to this rule is oral poliovirus vaccine (OPV), which can be given at any time before or after measles vaccination without interference in the response to either vaccine.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for measles supplementary dose
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with measles supplementary dose as live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks. Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for supplementary dose.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Consider measles supplementary dose. Create a clinical note: Consider measles supplementary dose. Create a clinical note "Immunization recommendation status" = "Further evaluation needed"
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Consider measles supplementary dose. Create a clinical note
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (May vaccinate client with measles supplementary dose as supplementary dose was not administered, measles routine immunization schedule is complete and no live vaccine administered in the past 4 weeks. Check if one of the measles supplementary dose specific scenarios is applicable.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Measles immunization schedule is complete: Measles immunization schedule is complete "Immunization recommendation status" = "Complete"
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Measles immunization schedule is complete
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Measles immunization schedule is complete. Measles supplementary dose was administered.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })

relatedArtifact.citation: WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1)

action.title: Client is not due for measles supplementary dose
action.description:
Client is not due for measles supplementary dose
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

An additional dose of MCV should be administered to children infected with HIV receiving highly active antiretroviral therapy (HAART) following immune reconstitution. If CD4+ T lymphocyte counts are monitored, an additional dose of MCV should be administered when immune reconstitution has been achieved (e.g. when the CD4+ T lymphocyte count reaches 20–25%). Where CD4+ T lymphocyte monitoring is not available, children should receive an additional dose of MCV 6–12 months after initiation of HAART.
As a general rule, live vaccines should be given either simultaneously or at intervals of 4 weeks. An exception to this rule is oral poliovirus vaccine (OPV), which can be given at any time before or after measles vaccination without interference in the response to either vaccine.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should not vaccinate client with measles supplementary dose as live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks.
Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for supplementary dose.

action.title: Consider measles supplementary dose. Create a clinical note
action.description:
Consider measles supplementary dose. Create a clinical note
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Further evaluation needed"

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
May vaccinate client with measles supplementary dose as supplementary dose was not administered, measles routine immunization schedule is complete and no live vaccine administered in the past 4 weeks.
Check if one of the measles supplementary dose specific scenarios is applicable.

action.title: Measles immunization schedule is complete
action.description:
Measles immunization schedule is complete
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Complete"

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression: Measles immunization schedule is complete. Measles supplementary dose was administered.
